intro: Gynandropsis muricata, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system for water absorption. The leaves and stems contain latex, which can be toxic if ingested.
